UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE

SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION,

                       v.                                 23 Civ. 4738 (KPF)
COINBASE, INC. AND COINBASE GLOBAL, INC.,

                                Defendants.




               MEMORANDUM OF LAW IN SUPPORT OF COINBASE’S
               MOTION TO COMPEL PRODUCTI

recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER granting in part and denying in part 35 Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings: For the forgoing reasons, the Court DENIES Defendants' motion for judgment on the pleadings insofar as the Court finds the SEC has sufficiently pleaded that Coinbase operates as an exchange, as a broker, and as a clearing agency under the federal securities laws, and, through its Staking Program, engages in the unregistered offer and sale of securities. The Court further finds that the SEC has sufficiently pleaded control person liability for CGI under the Exchange Act. The Court GRANTS Defendants' motion, however, with respect to the SEC's claims regarding Wallet. The Clerk of Court is directed to terminate the motion at docket entry 35. The parties are directed to submit a proposed case management plan on or before April 19, 2024. (Signed by Judge Katherine Polk Failla on 3/27/2024) (tn) (Entered: 03/27/2024)

January 30, 2024
The Honorable Donna M. Ryu
United States District Court for the Northern District of California

1301 Clay Street
Oakland, CA 94612

       RE:     J. Doe 1 et al., v. GitHub Inc., et al., Case No. 4:22-CV-06823-JST (“Action”)

Dear Judge Ryu:
